\pard\cf1\f0\fs24\lang1033 ###Turkish. Ablative\par
\par
#words\par
\'e7\f1\u305?k\u305?yorum\f0  - getting out (going out)\par
\'e7\f1\u305?kmak\f0  - exit, quit, go out\par
\par
Ben \'e7\f1\u305?k\u305?yorum.\f0  I am going out.\par
Park\f1\u305? evimden g\f0\'f6r\'fcyorum. I see the park from my house.\par
Bu yumurtay\f1\u305? k\f0\'f6yden al\f1\u305?yoruz.\f0  We are buying this egg from the village.\par
Ofisten gidiyorum. I am going out of the office.\par
===\f2\lang1049\'e4\'e5\'eb\'e0\'f2\'fc \'ef\'f0\'e0\'ea\'f2\'e8\'f7\'e5\'f1\'ea\'e8\'e5 \'f3\'ef\'f0\'e0\'e6\'ed\'e5\'ed\'e8\'ff \'f1 \'ea\'f3\'f1\'ea\'ee\'ec \'f4\'f0\'e0\'e7\'fb, \f0\lang1033 to be going out of ...\par
G\'fcneyde g\'fczel k\f1\u305?zlar var.\f0  There are beautiful girls in the south.\par
\f2\lang1049 Bu g\f0\lang1033\'fczel mahalleden gidiyorum. I am leaving this beautiful neighborhood.\par
Sinemada seni bekliyorum. I am waiting for you at the movie theater.\par
\par
Adada kim var? Who is there on the island? Who is on the island?\par
Park\f1\u305? evimden g\f0\'f6r\'fcyorum. I see the park from my house.\par
Hastaneden \'e7\f1\u305?k\u305?yorum.\f0  I am going out of the hospital.\par
\f2\lang1049 Bu yumurtay\f1\u305? k\f0\lang1033\'f6yden al\f1\u305?yoruz.\f0  We are buying this egg from the village.\f2\lang1049\par
Gitmek = go; \f0\lang1033\'e7\f1\u305?kmak = leave (in this context, although it has a zillion uses!)\f2\lang1049\par
Adadan geliyorlar.\f0\lang1033  They are coming from the island.\par
You are coming from the bar. Bardan geliyorsun.\par
The cook is going out of the kitchen. A\f1\'ba\f0\'e7\f1\u305? mutfaktan \f0\'e7\f1\u305?k\u305?yor.\f0\par
\par
\par
\par
\par
\par
\f2\lang1049\par
\par
\par

TxtContent:
###Turkish. Ablative

#words
çıkıyorum - getting out (going out)
çıkmak - exit, quit, go out

Ben çıkıyorum. I am going out.
Parkı evimden görüyorum. I see the park from my house.
Bu yumurtayı köyden alıyoruz. We are buying this egg from the village.
Ofisten gidiyorum. I am going out of the office.
===делать практические упражнения с куском фразы, to be going out of ...
Güneyde güzel kızlar var. There are beautiful girls in the south.
Bu güzel mahalleden gidiyorum. I am leaving this beautiful neighborhood.
Sinemada seni bekliyorum. I am waiting for you at the movie theater.

Adada kim var? Who is there on the island? Who is on the island?
Parkı evimden görüyorum. I see the park from my house.
Hastaneden çıkıyorum. I am going out of the hospital.
Bu yumurtayı köyden alıyoruz. We are buying this egg from the village.
Gitmek = go; çıkmak = leave (in this context, although it has a zillion uses!)
Adadan geliyorlar. They are coming from the island.
You are coming from the bar. Bardan geliyorsun.
The cook is going out of the kitchen. Aşçı mutfaktan çıkıyor.
